snippet: First baseman Ike Davis is hitting .179 with four home runs. He has been dropped from his cleanup spot in the batting order.
abstract: New York Mets first baseman Ike Davis is hitting .179 with only four home runs and has dropped out of his cleanup spot in the batting order; Davis's three-run homer against the Philadelphia Phillies could be a sign of better things.
lead_paragraph: First baseman Ike Davis is hitting .179 with four home runs. He has been dropped from his cleanup spot in the batting order.

headline.seo: Ike Davis Struggles Amid the Mets’ Bright Start
headline.main: Mets Are Connecting; Davis Is Still Trying
headline.print_headline: Mets Are Connecting; Davis Is Still Trying
